revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-10-12 06:41:04.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/openvswitch/agent/ovs_neutron_agent.py', 'neutron/agent/common/ovs_lib.py'], 'message': 'ovs: ovs agent updates the wrong port when using Xen + Neutron
Problem:
When VM is under HVM mode, ovs will create two ports and two interfaces for
a single virtual ethernet interface inside the VM: One is named as tapx.0
which is qemu-emulated NIC, used when no PV drivers installed; The other
one is named as vifx.0 which is the xen network frontend NIC, used when
VM has PV drivers installed. Depending on the PV driver's existing,
either of the two ports/interfaces will be used. But current implement
can NOT process multiple ports/interfaces. If it configures(e.g. set tag)
one interface but the other one is in fact used by ovs; it will have
network problem.

Solution:
 There are two potential solutions:
 1. configure both ports regardless which port will be used by ovs; so
 both have the same configuration.
 2. if there are multiple choices, ovs set the filed of "iface-status" as
active for the one taking effective; and others will be inactive. So the
other solution is to return the active one only. If there is any
switchover happens in later phase, the returned ofport should be changed
as the ofport is uniq for each port. Then treat this port as updated and
then it will configure the new chosen port accordingly.
 As the existing relative functions is implemented basing on the
assumption that only one single port/interface exists for each virtual
interface inside the VM. With the 1st solution, it requires much more
effort to change the existing data structure to hold multiple
ports/interfaces and corresponding it will make things more complicated.
So the 2nd solution has been chosen within this patch set.

Change-Id: I06e5e9123731e01e04c5f7f15ef857703521adc7
Closes-Bug: #1268955
'}]
commit_message:
ovs: ovs agent updates the wrong port when using Xen + Neutron
Problem:
When VM is under HVM mode, ovs will create two ports and two interfaces for
a single virtual ethernet interface inside the VM: One is named as tapx.0
which is qemu-emulated NIC, used when no PV drivers installed; The other
one is named as vifx.0 which is the xen network frontend NIC, used when
VM has PV drivers installed. Depending on the PV driver's existing,
either of the two ports/interfaces will be used. But current implement
can NOT process multiple ports/interfaces. If it configures(e.g. set tag)
one interface but the other one is in fact used by ovs; it will have
network problem.

Solution:
 There are two potential solutions:
 1. configure both ports regardless which port will be used by ovs; so
 both have the same configuration.
 2. if there are multiple choices, ovs set the filed of "iface-status" as
active for the one taking effective; and others will be inactive. So the
other solution is to return the active one only. If there is any
switchover happens in later phase, the returned ofport should be changed
as the ofport is uniq for each port. Then treat this port as updated and
then it will configure the new chosen port accordingly.
 As the existing relative functions is implemented basing on the
assumption that only one single port/interface exists for each virtual
interface inside the VM. With the 1st solution, it requires much more
effort to change the existing data structure to hold multiple
ports/interfaces and corresponding it will make things more complicated.
So the 2nd solution has been chosen within this patch set.

Change-Id: I06e5e9123731e01e04c5f7f15ef857703521adc7
Closes-Bug: #1268955

commit_message:
Consolidate module constants.

3 separate places had hardcoded values for the t-h-t directory. Many
values are/will be shared, this patch consolidates them to avoid having
them diverge in the future.

Change-Id: I205569f4be0bcee2b284048dec7ddf0b28bbd8a1

subject: Set --min-tmpfs for overcloud-full build
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-10-14 16:16:26.000000000', 'files': ['tripleoclient/v1/overcloud_image.py', 'tripleoclient/tests/v1/overcloud_image/test_overcloud_image.py'], 'message': "Set --min-tmpfs for overcloud-full build

I consistently have problems building images on an 8 GB VM with
the undercloud already installed (which is the documented flow).
At 4 or 12 GB it works fine, but 8 seems to fall in a sweet spot
where the tmpfs usage of dib causes OOM problems.  4 GB works
because dib doesn't use tmpfs by default with that little memory,
and 12 GB seems to be sufficient to avoid running out of memory
even with tmpfs.

This changes passes the --min-tmpfs 5 parameter to the image build
for the overcloud-full image (the largest image by far) so it will
not attempt to build in tmpfs if there is less than 12 GB of RAM.
5 instead of 6 because due to rounding 6 would result in tmpfs not
being used on 12 GB VMs either (similar to how it is not used on a
4 GB VM even though the default is 2).

Note that tmpfs by default uses half of total memory, which is why
all of the min-tmpfs numbers are half of the expected memory on the
system.

Change-Id: I6254d04216936551e68ac02999f2bffc11b19f65
"}]
commit_message:
Set --min-tmpfs for overcloud-full build

I consistently have problems building images on an 8 GB VM with
the undercloud already installed (which is the documented flow).
At 4 or 12 GB it works fine, but 8 seems to fall in a sweet spot
where the tmpfs usage of dib causes OOM problems.  4 GB works
because dib doesn't use tmpfs by default with that little memory,
and 12 GB seems to be sufficient to avoid running out of memory
even with tmpfs.

This changes passes the --min-tmpfs 5 parameter to the image build
for the overcloud-full image (the largest image by far) so it will
not attempt to build in tmpfs if there is less than 12 GB of RAM.
5 instead of 6 because due to rounding 6 would result in tmpfs not
being used on 12 GB VMs either (similar to how it is not used on a
4 GB VM even though the default is 2).

Note that tmpfs by default uses half of total memory, which is why
all of the min-tmpfs numbers are half of the expected memory on the
system.

Change-Id: I6254d04216936551e68ac02999f2bffc11b19f65

commit_message:
Install Guide Cleanup

This commit does the following:

- sets all shell prompts in code-blocks to the root prompt
- uses shell-session code-block since the shell prompt was being
  treated as a comment
- links configure-aodh.rst in configure.rst (running tox was
  complaining that this file wasn't being linked anywhere)
- other minor cleanup

Change-Id: I9e3ac8bb0cabd1cc17952cfd765dbb0d8f7b6fa2

commit_message:
Make Ceph install from Source on RPM

Ceph doesnt install from source on RPM because Ceph pulls in
python-requests.  This causes a cpio error during unpacking
because requests is installed in the base image.  A simple
workaround is to remove in the nova-compute container which
is the only container this conflict occurs within.

backport: liberty

Change-Id: I493900854a53c98f1a5cb6478675a18feceefea5
Closes-Bug: #1508236
(cherry picked from commit 194bb93ff26cfda92ff79742d361350a353ecacd)

subject: Add option to generate sample conf file.
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-10-21 03:43:24.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Add option to generate sample conf file.

The README says you can generate it :
https://github.com/openstack/senlin/blob/master/etc/senlin/README-senlin.conf.txt
but this option was missing.
This patch allows user to use `tox -egenconfig` to directly
generate a sample conf file in etc/senlin/senlin.conf.sample.
This helps in vetting any doubts if the already given conf is
outdated or has incorrect config options.

Change-Id: I6f8aa4cd9fd7f5296997469f04a333d67e9ddbd5
'}]
commit_message:
Add option to generate sample conf file.

The README says you can generate it :
https://github.com/openstack/senlin/blob/master/etc/senlin/README-senlin.conf.txt
but this option was missing.
This patch allows user to use `tox -egenconfig` to directly
generate a sample conf file in etc/senlin/senlin.conf.sample.
This helps in vetting any doubts if the already given conf is
outdated or has incorrect config options.

Change-Id: I6f8aa4cd9fd7f5296997469f04a333d67e9ddbd5

subject: Revert "Make gate-tempest-dsvm-networking-ovn voting"
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-10-21 00:14:25.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'Revert "Make gate-tempest-dsvm-networking-ovn voting"

This patch reverts commit dea4c2cce33b6a6f0d18caca485be89e82ed51c0.

Our tempest job has been passing, but OVN itself is going through some
*major* changes quite rapidly, and it's a bumpy ride adapting
networking-ovn to those changes.  We need to update networking-ovn to
use OVN's new support for ACLs (security groups), distributed routing,
and more.  It will be much easier if we can work through all of that in
several patches and then turn voting back on.

Change-Id: If54532c79d1331f2154ed74697ce0e46fd652e91
Signed-off-by: Russell Bryant <rbryant@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Make gate-tempest-dsvm-networking-ovn voting"

This patch reverts commit dea4c2cce33b6a6f0d18caca485be89e82ed51c0.

Our tempest job has been passing, but OVN itself is going through some
*major* changes quite rapidly, and it's a bumpy ride adapting
networking-ovn to those changes.  We need to update networking-ovn to
use OVN's new support for ACLs (security groups), distributed routing,
and more.  It will be much easier if we can work through all of that in
several patches and then turn voting back on.

Change-Id: If54532c79d1331f2154ed74697ce0e46fd652e91
Signed-off-by: Russell Bryant <rbryant@redhat.com>

   * Tables

subject: Increase Ceph RPM gpg key timeout to 90 seconds
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-10-20 22:47:02.000000000', 'files': ['docker/base/ceph.yum.repo'], 'message': 'Increase Ceph RPM gpg key timeout to 90 seconds

The default timeout for Ceph GPG rpm key retrieval is 30 seconds.
In my testing, the GPG key takes approximately 50 seconds to download
often resulting in a failure to build containers that need to retrieve
the Ceph GPG sign key.  Crank up the timer to 90 seconds so the key
is more likely to be downloaded, allowing images to be built.

backport: liberty

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I7420cdf8d3b61aa9f4f52795fccbe5da3e48d57b
(cherry picked from commit a026ec253a616aa147cff72f43a38eda90789b0a)
'}]
commit_message:
Increase Ceph RPM gpg key timeout to 90 seconds

The default timeout for Ceph GPG rpm key retrieval is 30 seconds.
In my testing, the GPG key takes approximately 50 seconds to download
often resulting in a failure to build containers that need to retrieve
the Ceph GPG sign key.  Crank up the timer to 90 seconds so the key
is more likely to be downloaded, allowing images to be built.

backport: liberty

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I7420cdf8d3b61aa9f4f52795fccbe5da3e48d57b
(cherry picked from commit a026ec253a616aa147cff72f43a38eda90789b0a)

revisions:
[{'number': 26, 'created': '2015-10-19 22:10:35.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/l3/dvr_local_router.py', 'neutron/tests/functional/agent/test_l3_agent.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/l3/test_dvr_local_router.py'], 'message': 'Split the FIP Namespace delete in L3 agent for DVR

Right now we are seeing a race condition in the l3 agent
for DVR routers when a floatingip is deleted and created.

The agent tries to delete the floatingip namespace and
while it tries to delete there is another call to add a
namespace. There is a timing window in between these two
calls where sometimes the call to create a namespace succeeds
but, when tried to execute any commands in the namespace
it fails, since the namespace was deleted concurrently.

Since the fip namespace is associated with an external net
and each node has only one fip namespace for an external net,
we would like to only delete the fip namespace when the
external net is deleted.

The first step is to split the delete functionality into two.
The call to fip_ns.cleanup will only remove the dependency that
the fipnamespace has with the router namespace such as fpr and
rfp veth pairs.

The call to fip_ns.delete will actually delete the
the fip namespace and the fg device.

Partial-Bug: #1501873
Change-Id: Ic94625d5a968f554af70c274b2b2c20ab64e2487
'}]
commit_message:
Split the FIP Namespace delete in L3 agent for DVR

Right now we are seeing a race condition in the l3 agent
for DVR routers when a floatingip is deleted and created.

The agent tries to delete the floatingip namespace and
while it tries to delete there is another call to add a
namespace. There is a timing window in between these two
calls where sometimes the call to create a namespace succeeds
but, when tried to execute any commands in the namespace
it fails, since the namespace was deleted concurrently.

Since the fip namespace is associated with an external net
and each node has only one fip namespace for an external net,
we would like to only delete the fip namespace when the
external net is deleted.

The first step is to split the delete functionality into two.
The call to fip_ns.cleanup will only remove the dependency that
the fipnamespace has with the router namespace such as fpr and
rfp veth pairs.

The call to fip_ns.delete will actually delete the
the fip namespace and the fg device.

Partial-Bug: #1501873
Change-Id: Ic94625d5a968f554af70c274b2b2c20ab64e2487

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-10-20 16:48:19.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_health/api.py'], 'message': "Ensure we log exceptions on 500 responses

When running the api server under a real wsgi container the exceptions
aren't being propagated to the log file. This makes debugging a 500
error very difficult. This commit adds the option to the flask app
to ensure that we propagate tracebacks into the log.

Change-Id: Ibc4be9f98aaf3e6cb17ccaa39095ad52ebdada35
"}]
commit_message:
Ensure we log exceptions on 500 responses

When running the api server under a real wsgi container the exceptions
aren't being propagated to the log file. This makes debugging a 500
error very difficult. This commit adds the option to the flask app
to ensure that we propagate tracebacks into the log.

Change-Id: Ibc4be9f98aaf3e6cb17ccaa39095ad52ebdada35

subject: REST Amp Agent: Compare lower case MAC Addresses
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6951, 'name': 'Brandon Logan', 'email': 'brandon.logan@rackspace.com', 'username': 'brandon-logan'}, {'_account_id': 8157, 'name': 'Bertrand LALLAU', 'email': 'bertrand.lallau@gmail.com', 'username': 'blallau'}, {'_account_id': 10273, 'name': 'Adam Harwell', 'email': 'flux.adam@gmail.com', 'username': 'rm_you'}, {'_account_id': 10806, 'name': 'Trevor Vardeman', 'email': 'tvardema@redhat.com', 'username': 'tvardeman'}, {'_account_id': 10850, 'name': 'German Eichberger', 'email': 'german.eichberger@gmail.com', 'username': 'german'}, {'_account_id': 16923, 'name': 'HP Octavia Sonar CI', 'email': 'octavia.sonar@gmail.com', 'username': 'octaviasonar', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-10-20 23:35:08.000000000', 'files': ['octavia/amphorae/backends/agent/api_server/plug.py', 'octavia/tests/unit/amphorae/backends/agent/api_server/test_plug.py'], 'message': 'REST Amp Agent: Compare lower case MAC Addresses

When the post_plug_vip method is called on the rest amphora driver,
the agent on the amphora running the rest server attempts to find the
interface by the MAC address passed in through the API. On some OSes
the interfaces returned by the OS has the mac address in all lower case,
whereas the MAC address passed in through the API is in upper case.
Just lower() both and then compare.

Closes-Bug: #1507881
Change-Id: I4ddfd25911d31285513009432f80da080196e8b2
'}]
commit_message:
REST Amp Agent: Compare lower case MAC Addresses

When the post_plug_vip method is called on the rest amphora driver,
the agent on the amphora running the rest server attempts to find the
interface by the MAC address passed in through the API. On some OSes
the interfaces returned by the OS has the mac address in all lower case,
whereas the MAC address passed in through the API is in upper case.
Just lower() both and then compare.

Closes-Bug: #1507881
Change-Id: I4ddfd25911d31285513009432f80da080196e8b2

commit_message:
Change Identity API default version to 3

Devstack now issues all v3 OSC commands for our CI, and since v3
has everything v2 has, we should be able to switch to v3.

Furthermore, most OSC users were initially  using OSC since they
were looking to exploit v3 keystone capabilities.

Change-Id: If7de86946f6dd0f148aa5f526155cccf90adfcc3

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-10-20 15:36:51.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/openvswitch/agent/ovs_neutron_agent.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/drivers/openvswitch/agent/test_ovs_neutron_agent.py'], 'message': 'Properly handle segmentation_id in OVS agent

The segmentation_id of a OVS VLAN can be None, but a recent change
assumed that it was always an integer. It highlighted the fact that we
try to store None in the OVS database, which got stored as a string.
This fixes the storage, and handles loading the value while keeping
compatibility.

Closes-Bug: #1494281
'}]
commit_message:
Properly handle segmentation_id in OVS agent

The segmentation_id of a OVS VLAN can be None, but a recent change
assumed that it was always an integer. It highlighted the fact that we
try to store None in the OVS database, which got stored as a string.
This fixes the storage, and handles loading the value while keeping
compatibility.

Change-Id: I6e7df1406c90ddde254467bb87ff1507a4caaadd
Closes-Bug: #1494281

commit_message:
Prevent false negative results during wait for resource deletion

This patch replaces get_status for latest_status to None value
to prevent 404 NotFound exception, if resource removed faster, than
wait code will interpreted.
Change-Id: I4f3baaf01e14d4794ce675ad37b300b876b9fc12

commit_message:
Support private address override in inventory

ansible inventory supports a command line switch --private which
overrides the clouds.yaml setting. Support passing it in.

Change-Id: I74bf98be26b605a5e9ac74ab478f421c39616d74

commit_message:
Revert "Match on dsvm-fedora-22 and dsvm-f21 nodes"

This reverts commit 29a714741b24c1247dfaf9fd2863fce3d8438602.

There is only one fedora node type, "fedora-22".  I think the
NOT_REGISTERED errors from the puppet jobs might have been related to
a zuul reload around the same time.

Change-Id: Ie8d6b9d1f9840627ada0e18d4a725b475be6d3ce

subject: WIP: Enable Role-based access control using oslo.policy in Swift
revisions:
[{'number': 15, 'created': '2015-06-17 09:25:59.000000000', 'files': ['swift/common/utils.py', 'test/unit/common/middleware/test_keystoneauth.py', 'test-requirements.txt', 'etc/proxy-server.conf-sample', 'swift/common/middleware/tempauth.py', 'swift/common/middleware/keystoneauth.py', 'etc/policy.json', 'test/unit/common/test_utils.py'], 'message': "WIP: Enable Role-based access control using oslo.policy in Swift

This patch realizes Role-based access control (RBAC) with Keystone
using oslo.policy library in Swift.

All keystoneauth authorisations logic were translated into json
policy format, to ensure backward compatibly.

Note that deployers need to specify a policy file which is created by
themselves. There is a default policy file which is stored in
/etc/swift/policy.json. The policy file can be a base of their cluster.

How does it work:
* keystoneauth works with a policy file which is specified in
  proxy-server.conf as policy_file.
* If 'reseller_admin_role', 'operator_roles' and 'service_roles' are
  specified in proxy-server.conf, keystoneauth updates the policy
  with the information and works with it.

Notes:
* oslo.policy seems to be not supported HTTP_X_SERVICE_ROLES so
  I created ServiceRoleCheck class but it is better to have it
  in the library. I will get in touch with oslo.policy guys about
  it.
* the method '_get_policy_json_file' in keystoneauth.py will be
  removed because this is only for backward compatibility of the
  gate.

Change-Id: Ia55b81cc14c9bf917c402e5a00c08365e4d340b1
Implements: blueprint updated-authorization-policy
"}]
commit_message:
WIP: Enable Role-based access control using oslo.policy in Swift

This patch realizes Role-based access control (RBAC) with Keystone
using oslo.policy library in Swift.

All keystoneauth authorisations logic were translated into json
policy format, to ensure backward compatibly.

Note that deployers need to specify a policy file which is created by
themselves. There is a default policy file which is stored in
/etc/swift/policy.json. The policy file can be a base of their cluster.

How does it work:
* keystoneauth works with a policy file which is specified in
  proxy-server.conf as policy_file.
* If 'reseller_admin_role', 'operator_roles' and 'service_roles' are
  specified in proxy-server.conf, keystoneauth updates the policy
  with the information and works with it.

Notes:
* oslo.policy seems to be not supported HTTP_X_SERVICE_ROLES so
  I created ServiceRoleCheck class but it is better to have it
  in the library. I will get in touch with oslo.policy guys about
  it.
* the method '_get_policy_json_file' in keystoneauth.py will be
  removed because this is only for backward compatibility of the
  gate.

Change-Id: Ia55b81cc14c9bf917c402e5a00c08365e4d340b1
Implements: blueprint updated-authorization-policy

commit_message:
Use testtools for base test class

The testtools library has been chosen as the project-wide testing base
class. It works across 2.6 and 2.7 and is a library that aims to develop
new testing features before inclusion in the standard library.

Change-Id: Id712f8ac6cade539a97d18e00f9dc7c584b29c99
Closes-Bug: #1179009

commit_message:
[install] remove Fedora from the install guide

According to
https://www.redhat.com/archives/rdo-list/2015-October/msg00234.html
OpenStack packages for Fedora will only provided through the
Delorean repository.

More details at https://trello.com/c/wzdl1IlZ/52-openstack-in-fedora:

---snip---
Fedora users (assumed to be developers who want latest code and not
running production) will use Delorean Trunk for Fedora repos.
---snap---

Change-Id: I1220fae10c6c212b6aab347d9886238e89200799

subject: Port swift.common.utils.backward() to Python 3
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-10-19 15:57:23.000000000', 'files': ['swift/common/utils.py', 'test/unit/common/test_utils.py'], 'message': "Port swift.common.utils.backward() to Python 3

backward() is written to handle binary files:

* Replace literal native strings to literal byte strings: add b'...'
  prefix
* Update unit tests: use byte strings
* TemporaryFile(): use the default mode 'w+b', instead of using 'r+w'
  ('r+w' mode creates a Unicode file on Python 3).

Change-Id: Ic91f7e6c605db0b888763080d49f0f501029837f
"}]
commit_message:
Port swift.common.utils.backward() to Python 3

backward() is written to handle binary files:

* Replace literal native strings to literal byte strings: add b'...'
  prefix
* Update unit tests: use byte strings
* TemporaryFile(): use the default mode 'w+b', instead of using 'r+w'
  ('r+w' mode creates a Unicode file on Python 3).

Change-Id: Ic91f7e6c605db0b888763080d49f0f501029837f

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-10-16 20:11:34.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/openvswitch/agent/ovs_neutron_agent.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/drivers/openvswitch/agent/test_ovs_neutron_agent.py'], 'message': "Fix AttributeError on port_bound for missing ports

If the port is concurrently deleted, db_get_val returns None, and
that causes the Exception to be raised. However, the exception is just
log noise if the port has been deleted concurrently and it does not
lead to failures.

This can happen if port_update and port_delete operations occur
in short sequence and interleave. To prevent this trace from
occurring, this patch checks that the port is being eliminated and
emits an error trace only if the port is indeed to be expected
amongst the list of ports to be updated.

We do not raise an exception to avoid disrupting the agent sync
process, and leave to the admin the investigation of the issue
(should that be cronic rather than transient).

Under normal circumstances, if the port is expected it should
be there, and if it isn't this should be treated as a bug to be
investigated further.

Closes-bug: #1455320

Change-Id: Ic609af0ef6a09b536c882c58c23167c0a469b155
"}]
commit_message:
Fix AttributeError on port_bound for missing ports

If the port is concurrently deleted, db_get_val returns None, and
that causes the Exception to be raised. However, the exception is just
log noise if the port has been deleted concurrently and it does not
lead to failures.

This can happen if port_update and port_delete operations occur
in short sequence and interleave. To prevent this trace from
occurring, this patch checks that the port is being eliminated and
emits an error trace only if the port is indeed to be expected
amongst the list of ports to be updated.

We do not raise an exception to avoid disrupting the agent sync
process, and leave to the admin the investigation of the issue
(should that be cronic rather than transient).

Under normal circumstances, if the port is expected it should
be there, and if it isn't this should be treated as a bug to be
investigated further.

Closes-bug: #1455320

Change-Id: Ic609af0ef6a09b536c882c58c23167c0a469b155

commit_message:
Improving JS unit test branch coverage

This patch is testing untested branches.

There is a bug in the Launch Instance model where it is supposed to
remove null properties from the top level of the model.  It is not doing
that properly.  So that bug is also fixed.

This patch currently raises the branch coverage in openstack_dashboard
from ~84% to ~89%.

Closes-bug: 1506891
Change-Id: I7434126246b15209b62daeff75744e0a3b435494

commit_message:

commit_message:
Pagination limit code refactor

The logic to find the pagination limit is
repeated several times and is not in one
function. This patch creates a function that
is called in various locations replacing
repetitive code.

Change-Id: I3eced6a4236e4189e57ea5a1589e8f0d411cc4e3
Closes-Bug:  #1308285

subject: Explain default domain in docs for other services
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-10-20 20:07:02.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/services.rst'], 'message': 'Explain default domain in docs for other services

The documentation for other services previously made an assertion that
(paraphrasing) "using v3 tokens on v2 works fine." That statement comes
with a laundry list of caveats, starting with the "default" domain.

This patch revises the documentation to introduce the default domain
first, and then enumerates the caveats that come as a result of mixing
and matching v2 and v3.

There's also some general RST syntax improvements, grammar improvements,
and line wrapping politely at 79 characters like your mother taught you
to do.

Change-Id: I342092b9c9971d44438fa83f547d1f5ddd204ced
'}]
commit_message:
Explain default domain in docs for other services

The documentation for other services previously made an assertion that
(paraphrasing) "using v3 tokens on v2 works fine." That statement comes
with a laundry list of caveats, starting with the "default" domain.

This patch revises the documentation to introduce the default domain
first, and then enumerates the caveats that come as a result of mixing
and matching v2 and v3.

There's also some general RST syntax improvements, grammar improvements,
and line wrapping politely at 79 characters like your mother taught you
to do.

Change-Id: I342092b9c9971d44438fa83f547d1f5ddd204ced

Policy Engine initializes Rule instances when Congress starts

loads persited rule string but doesn't set other infomation,
id, name and comment. This patch lets Policy Engine set the

commit_message:
Sets loaded rule info to Rule instances

Policy Engine initializes Rule instances when Congress starts
if rules are persited in db. The bug is that Policy Engine only
loads persited rule string but doesn't set other infomation,
id, name and comment. This patch lets Policy Engine set the
lacked infomations to Rule instance.

Closes-Bug: #1507329
Change-Id: Id8354d9bff0d5b5938406473e2f344e726bd2f3c

subject: Revise nova server get_details call
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-10-11 04:07:26.000000000', 'files': ['senlin/profiles/os/nova/server.py', 'senlin/tests/unit/profiles/test_nova_server.py'], 'message': 'Revise nova server get_details call

This patch revises the get_details call for the nova server profile. The
goal is to make the output looks more closer to that of nova show
command. Another reason is that we need to expose all attributes of a
nova server so that some policies (such as placement policy) can check
the required attributes (e.g. availability zone of a node).

Change-Id: I438a01c8910f3bfc071ff1e71389b454d0c94662
'}]
commit_message:
Revise nova server get_details call

This patch revises the get_details call for the nova server profile. The
goal is to make the output looks more closer to that of nova show
command. Another reason is that we need to expose all attributes of a
nova server so that some policies (such as placement policy) can check
the required attributes (e.g. availability zone of a node).

Change-Id: I438a01c8910f3bfc071ff1e71389b454d0c94662

commit_message:

management. Supporting regions is important for multi-region
deployments.

commit_message:

When showing a nested table, the current formatting logic preserves the
quote marks when displaying a JSON or sometimes a string. This patch
proposes a change to strip of the quotes so the values are shown in more
consistent way.

commit_message:
Set cache information from clouds.yaml

With 1.9.0 of os-client-config, there are appropriate methods
on the cloud_config object which allow access to cache config settings.
Additionally, there is a documented mechanism for passing in
per-resource cache timing, for things like list_servers.

Depends-On: I352f827715821db8a69983eae0ee3e9c8c99f512
Change-Id: Iba9af1cdddf0844c885ff203f67a522dc451a3ed

Environment is deleted instatly from murano DB after delete API
request is finished:
https://github.com/openstack/murano/blob/0ced0071095248283ec4f95aadeaea962e096fa9/murano/api/v1/environments.py#L158-L173

It means next thing:
* We shouldn't use wait_for in this case
* We should use SynchronizedDeletion in resource cleanup
* We shouldn't make hacks in get_status() to make this work

This patch cleans up conf options as well

Change-Id: Ib495afc79229ab0bb9f9eb40388c00a618b84cb1
"}]
commit_message:
Fix Murano delete environment

Environment is deleted instatly from murano DB after delete API
request is finished:
https://github.com/openstack/murano/blob/0ced0071095248283ec4f95aadeaea962e096fa9/murano/api/v1/environments.py#L158-L173

It means next thing:
* We shouldn't use wait_for in this case
* We should use SynchronizedDeletion in resource cleanup
* We shouldn't make hacks in get_status() to make this work

This patch cleans up conf options as well

Change-Id: Ib495afc79229ab0bb9f9eb40388c00a618b84cb1

These two projects were used as part of the setup for the

commit_message:
Remove jeepyb and pypi-mirror from PROJECTS

These two projects were used as part of the setup for the
requirements/pbr testing but that is no longer the case. In fact
requirements and pbr both have special casing to ignore these projects
in the PROJECTS list now. Remove them to shorten the PROJECTS list which
simplifies test run workspace setup.

Change-Id: I61c2f3f8a724dc789479278e7ba493e095c52305

commit_message:
Use the liberty release RDO RPMS

Previously stable/liberty was using the Delorean repositories for
installing RPM packaging.  Delorean is master, and up until just about
now that made sense, but going forward, we want to use the Liberty
release of RDO rather then Mitaka for stable/liberty ;)

Closes-Bug: #1508127

Change-Id: I675c434d25419853bb3ce6442d1b4db6ea448af0

subject: Increase Ceph RPM gpg key timeout to 90 seconds
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-10-20 20:28:20.000000000', 'files': ['docker/base/ceph.yum.repo'], 'message': 'Increase Ceph RPM gpg key timeout to 90 seconds

The default timeout for Ceph GPG rpm key retrieval is 30 seconds.
In my testing, the GPG key takes approximately 50 seconds to download
often resulting in a failure to build containers that need to retrieve
the Ceph GPG sign key.  Crank up the timer to 90 seconds so the key
is more likely to be downloaded, allowing images to be built.

backport: liberty

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I7420cdf8d3b61aa9f4f52795fccbe5da3e48d57b
'}]
commit_message:
Increase Ceph RPM gpg key timeout to 90 seconds

The default timeout for Ceph GPG rpm key retrieval is 30 seconds.
In my testing, the GPG key takes approximately 50 seconds to download
often resulting in a failure to build containers that need to retrieve
the Ceph GPG sign key.  Crank up the timer to 90 seconds so the key
is more likely to be downloaded, allowing images to be built.

backport: liberty

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I7420cdf8d3b61aa9f4f52795fccbe5da3e48d57b

subject: Support the format of crash dump directory for RHEL7.1 and CentOS7.1
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2015-10-19 12:12:51.000000000', 'files': ['monasca_agent/collector/checks_d/crash.py'], 'message': 'Support the format of crash dump directory for RHEL7.1 and CentOS7.1

Currently, crash checks support only below format.
YYYYMMddHHmm (e.g. 201509032311)
Support the format of RHEL7.1 and CentOS7.1.
<IP-address>-YYYY.MM.dd-HH:mm:ss (e.g. 127.0.0.1-2015.10.02-16:07:51)

Change-Id: Ia023edc3505e584200b043814480bfcfbd60920c
Closes-Bug: #1500766
'}]
commit_message:
Support the format of crash dump directory for RHEL7.1 and CentOS7.1

Currently, crash checks support only below format.
YYYYMMddHHmm (e.g. 201509032311)
Support the format of RHEL7.1 and CentOS7.1.
<IP-address>-YYYY.MM.dd-HH:mm:ss (e.g. 127.0.0.1-2015.10.02-16:07:51)

Change-Id: Ia023edc3505e584200b043814480bfcfbd60920c
Closes-Bug: #1500766

commit_message:
Correct MAC representation to match iptables output

We were previously using the netaddr's mac_unix format
(which leaves off leading 0's) to generate iptables rules
based on MAC addresses. While iptables accepts this format,
it's not returned this way in the output so the iptables
rule matching code would never find the match for these
rules, causing the loss of counters on these rules on every
reload.

This patch corrects this with a custom dialect that matches
the iptables format.

Closes-Bug: #1502901
Change-Id: Ia45ebde8c4684e12030469323e18367a54d1518b
(cherry picked from commit 5cab062465af06be3827de4e7f9014ab1040bdbf)

subject: support mysql+pymysql in functional test
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-10-16 18:09:16.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/tests/db.py'], 'message': "support mysql+pymysql in functional test

Currently, if we use PyMySQL as MySQL driver, database connection
url will be set to mysql+pymysql://, but our functional test doesn't
recognize such engine name, which finally will skip all the functional
test for mysql backend.

This patch simply maps mysql+pymysql to mysql.

Change-Id: I924de57e9f194f183a405846a6ac98968a2483d3
Closes-Bug: #1506777
(cherry picked from commit bf85df219e02dd1203457eb88eda32b3871aa3c4)
"}]
commit_message:
support mysql+pymysql in functional test

Currently, if we use PyMySQL as MySQL driver, database connection
url will be set to mysql+pymysql://, but our functional test doesn't
recognize such engine name, which finally will skip all the functional
test for mysql backend.

This patch simply maps mysql+pymysql to mysql.

Change-Id: I924de57e9f194f183a405846a6ac98968a2483d3
Closes-Bug: #1506777
(cherry picked from commit bf85df219e02dd1203457eb88eda32b3871aa3c4)

commit_message:
Increase timeout when testing admin timeout

When running functional tests in a slow virtual environment,
the given timeout of 10 seconds to list thr available instances
is not enough. Increase the timeout to not run into
a "timed out (HTTP 408)".

commit_message:
Update paths due to stackforge migration.

fuel-library repository has been moved from stackforge/ to openstack/ namespace.

fuel-tasklib repository got deprecated during migration, but it appears it is
still used in fuel-library CI. We add temporary workaround to run CI job
using fuel-tasklib package from fixed commit. The problem will be properly resolved
via related bug #1507208.

Change-Id: I8e2342c869a27fa1bb104fd46138ad27270f2d73
Related-Bug: #1507208

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-10-19 17:51:04.000000000', 'files': ['overcloud-without-mergepy.yaml'], 'message': 'Allow ctlplane network or ID, and default to "ctlplane"

Currently you always have to pass the ctlplane ID because we're still
using the deprecated network_id property for the neutron port resource.

Since Juno, heat has supported a "network" property, which is used
elsewhere, e.g the nested port stacks, so switch to using it in the
overcloud-without-mergepy template, and flip the default to a more
useful "ctlplane" vs an empty string.

This means the stack create should just work on commonly documented
deployments without requiring any parameter.

Change-Id: Ifcea36d26b795c5e8b80accd8112e23b254127be
'}]
commit_message:
Allow ctlplane network or ID, and default to "ctlplane"

Currently you always have to pass the ctlplane ID because we're still
using the deprecated network_id property for the neutron port resource.

Since Juno, heat has supported a "network" property, which is used
elsewhere, e.g the nested port stacks, so switch to using it in the
overcloud-without-mergepy template, and flip the default to a more
useful "ctlplane" vs an empty string.

This means the stack create should just work on commonly documented
deployments without requiring any parameter.

Change-Id: Ifcea36d26b795c5e8b80accd8112e23b254127be

subject: Increase replicator log level if nothing got replicated
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-05-07 08:07:25.000000000', 'files': ['swift/obj/replicator.py', 'test/unit/obj/test_replicator.py'], 'message': 'Increase replicator log level if nothing got replicated

Sometimes nothing is replicated at all, and if an operator set the loglevel to
warning only this will not show up in the logs.
This patch increases the log level to warning, but only for the final call to
stats_line() of the replication run; intermediate calls to stats_line() executed
by the heartbeat method are still logging using the info loglevel.

Also add two simple tests for stats_line, checking calculated output.

Change-Id: I6fe46bdd1a02481211a6eda9978e816881446fc1
'}]
commit_message:
Increase replicator log level if nothing got replicated

Sometimes nothing is replicated at all, and if an operator set the loglevel to
warning only this will not show up in the logs.
This patch increases the log level to warning, but only for the final call to
stats_line() of the replication run; intermediate calls to stats_line() executed
by the heartbeat method are still logging using the info loglevel.

Also add two simple tests for stats_line, checking calculated output.

Change-Id: I6fe46bdd1a02481211a6eda9978e816881446fc1

commit_message:
Swift-Storlets - allowing dynamic compute functions

A new middleware for Openstack Swift allowing to dynamically add
compute functions along the pipeline, without the need to epxlicitly
add new middleware.

Code reference can be found here:
    https://github.com/Open-I-Beam/swift-storlets

Additional exit codes for swift-drive-audit

Encode the swift-drive-audit result and the actions performed in the exit
status, in particular if a drive was unmounted or was not available.

subject: Support of the Linux socket option SO_REUSEPORT
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 597, 'name': 'Pete Zaitcev', 'email': 'zaitcev@kotori.zaitcev.us', 'username': 'zaitcev'}, {'_account_id': 1179, 'name': 'Clay Gerrard', 'email': 'clay.gerrard@gmail.com', 'username': 'clay-gerrard'}, {'_account_id': 6968, 'name': 'Christian Schwede', 'email': 'cschwede@redhat.com', 'username': 'cschwede'}, {'_account_id': 7479, 'name': 'paul luse', 'email': 'paul.e.luse@intel.com', 'username': 'peluse'}, {'_account_id': 7847, 'name': 'Alistair Coles', 'email': 'alistairncoles@gmail.com', 'username': 'acoles'}, {'_account_id': 8871, 'name': 'Elastic Recheck', 'username': 'elasticrecheck'}, {'_account_id': 9625, 'name': 'Thiago da Silva', 'email': 'thiagodasilva@gmail.com', 'username': 'thiago'}, {'_account_id': 10068, 'name': 'Welcome, new contributor!', 'username': 'welcome-message'}, {'_account_id': 13052, 'name': 'SwiftStack Cluster CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'swiftstack-cluster-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 13780, 'name': 'Arnaud', 'email': 'arnaud.jost@ovh.net', 'username': 'arnaud-jost'}, {'_account_id': 13852, 'name': 'Romain LE DISEZ', 'email': 'romain.le-disez@corp.ovh.com', 'username': 'rledisez'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2015-04-21 09:04:19.000000000', 'files': ['bin/swift-container-server', 'swift/common/utils.py', 'bin/swift-object-server', 'bin/swift-account-server', 'swift/common/manager.py', 'test/unit/common/test_manager.py', 'swift/common/wsgi.py', 'test/unit/common/test_utils.py', 'test/unit/common/test_wsgi.py', 'bin/swift-proxy-server', 'doc/source/admin_guide.rst'], 'message': 'Support of the Linux socket option SO_REUSEPORT

To reload servers processes, the current behavior is to send a HUP to the
process that will (gently) terminate the server. Then, another server must be
started. It means that during that short interval, no processes are listening
for incoming requests.

Linux, since version 3.9, added a new option for TCP and UDP sockets:
SO_REUSEPORT. Multiple processes can bind to the same port if they
each set the SO_REUSEPORT option.

This feature have two usages. It loadbalances the traffic over
multiple processes, useful when the server is not multithreaded. It
also helps to provide a zero-downtime restart by allowing that, at any time,
there is always at least one process listening for incoming requests.
Zero-downtime restart is the main objective of that patch.

The new behavior is to enable the socket option, when available, for
account|container|object|proxy server. The option is considered available when
the underlying OS is Linux>=3.9.

The new runtime options --finish=<pid> and --terminate=<pid> send,
respectively, the signals SIGHUP and SIGTERM to the pid specified.

To execute a zero-downtime restart, a new server must be started with
the --finish=$PID option, where $PID is the pid of the currently
running process.

Example, for a proxy server:
    /usr/bin/python /usr/bin/swift-proxy-server \
        /etc/swift/proxy-server.conf \
        --finish $(cat /var/run/swift/proxy-server.pid)

The swift-init command is modified to use these options when appropriate.

Change-Id: I3a6cd3635545402203fa8c5de0c43ede81fb7c0e
'}]
commit_message:
Support of the Linux socket option SO_REUSEPORT

To reload servers processes, the current behavior is to send a HUP to the
process that will (gently) terminate the server. Then, another server must be
started. It means that during that short interval, no processes are listening
for incoming requests.

Linux, since version 3.9, added a new option for TCP and UDP sockets:
SO_REUSEPORT. Multiple processes can bind to the same port if they
each set the SO_REUSEPORT option.

This feature have two usages. It loadbalances the traffic over
multiple processes, useful when the server is not multithreaded. It
also helps to provide a zero-downtime restart by allowing that, at any time,
there is always at least one process listening for incoming requests.
Zero-downtime restart is the main objective of that patch.

The new behavior is to enable the socket option, when available, for
account|container|object|proxy server. The option is considered available when
the underlying OS is Linux>=3.9.

The new runtime options --finish=<pid> and --terminate=<pid> send,
respectively, the signals SIGHUP and SIGTERM to the pid specified.

To execute a zero-downtime restart, a new server must be started with
the --finish=$PID option, where $PID is the pid of the currently
running process.

Example, for a proxy server:
    /usr/bin/python /usr/bin/swift-proxy-server \
        /etc/swift/proxy-server.conf \
        --finish $(cat /var/run/swift/proxy-server.pid)

The swift-init command is modified to use these options when appropriate.

Change-Id: I3a6cd3635545402203fa8c5de0c43ede81fb7c0e

subject: object-replicator warns when object dirs mismatch with policy settings
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 330, 'name': 'John Dickinson', 'email': 'me@not.mn', 'username': 'notmyname'}, {'_account_id': 7233, 'name': 'Matthew Oliver', 'email': 'matt@oliver.net.au', 'username': 'mattoliverau'}, {'_account_id': 8859, 'name': 'Daisuke Morita', 'email': 'morita.daisuke@ntti3.com', 'username': 'morrisson'}, {'_account_id': 13052, 'name': 'SwiftStack Cluster CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'swiftstack-cluster-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 14271, 'name': 'Kallebe Monteiro', 'email': 'kallebe.monteiro@lsbd.ufc.br', 'username': 'kallebe'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-03-12 11:08:39.000000000', 'files': ['swift/obj/replicator.py', 'test/unit/obj/test_replicator.py'], 'message': "object-replicator warns when object dirs mismatch with policy settings

Currently, object-replicator runs only for 'objects-<policy_idx>'
directories whose 'idx' is defined in swift.conf. This means that, for
example, if there are 'objects', 'objects-1' and 'objects-2' directories
in some devices but swift.conf only contains [storage-policy:0] and
[storage-policy:1] sections, object-replicator does not seek 'objects-2'
directory.

However, operators cannot be noticed that replicator does not work for
'objects-2' dir because there is no log output. Therefore, this can cause
delay in detecting config mismatches among swift servers or other
unexpected situations and then, in the worst case, this can cause data
losses.

This patch enables to output logs in the case of the mismatch between
object directory infomation and swift.conf. This mismatch check process
is executed after the completion of replication processes because the
sooner a replicator process starts the better.

Change-Id: Ie005775a626f12b0d0fb339533e63918978a89f2
Related-Bug: 1375438
"}]
commit_message:
object-replicator warns when object dirs mismatch with policy settings

Currently, object-replicator runs only for 'objects-<policy_idx>'
directories whose 'idx' is defined in swift.conf. This means that, for
example, if there are 'objects', 'objects-1' and 'objects-2' directories
in some devices but swift.conf only contains [storage-policy:0] and
[storage-policy:1] sections, object-replicator does not seek 'objects-2'
directory.

However, operators cannot be noticed that replicator does not work for
'objects-2' dir because there is no log output. Therefore, this can cause
delay in detecting config mismatches among swift servers or other
unexpected situations and then, in the worst case, this can cause data
losses.

This patch enables to output logs in the case of the mismatch between
object directory infomation and swift.conf. This mismatch check process
is executed after the completion of replication processes because the
sooner a replicator process starts the better.

Change-Id: Ie005775a626f12b0d0fb339533e63918978a89f2
Related-Bug: 1375438

subject: Sync local regions first, and always shuffle nodes
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-03-04 16:41:00.000000000', 'files': ['swift/obj/replicator.py', 'test/unit/obj/test_replicator.py'], 'message': 'Sync local regions first, and always shuffle nodes

Move the recently added shuffle nodes call from ObjectReplicator.update under
the common collect_jobs method so it also benifits update and update_deleted.

When primary locations span more than two regions, attempt to sync
cross-region in a deterministic fashion so that efficent replication has the
best chance of an even distribution of WAN traffic (region 0 will push to 1
which will push to 2, then region 0 can delete its handoff).

N.B. the use of region id is only to ensure deterministic ordering, and not
ment to convey any knowledge of region locality, but it theoretically could be
made configurable to handle affinity awareness.

Change-Id: I4b05d2efd647cead4e96d0aca5d89aaf3792aa21
'}]
commit_message:
Sync local regions first, and always shuffle nodes

Move the recently added shuffle nodes call from ObjectReplicator.update under
the common collect_jobs method so it also benifits update and update_deleted.

When primary locations span more than two regions, attempt to sync
cross-region in a deterministic fashion so that efficent replication has the
best chance of an even distribution of WAN traffic (region 0 will push to 1
which will push to 2, then region 0 can delete its handoff).

N.B. the use of region id is only to ensure deterministic ordering, and not
ment to convey any knowledge of region locality, but it theoretically could be
made configurable to handle affinity awareness.

Change-Id: I4b05d2efd647cead4e96d0aca5d89aaf3792aa21

subject: Cleanup object-replicator handoff/rebalance partition syncing
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 330, 'name': 'John Dickinson', 'email': 'me@not.mn', 'username': 'notmyname'}, {'_account_id': 1179, 'name': 'Clay Gerrard', 'email': 'clay.gerrard@gmail.com', 'username': 'clay-gerrard'}, {'_account_id': 2622, 'name': 'Samuel Merritt', 'email': 'sam@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'torgomatic'}, {'_account_id': 4608, 'name': 'Kota Tsuyuzaki', 'email': 'bloodeagle40234@gmail.com', 'username': 'tsuyuzaki-kota'}, {'_account_id': 7479, 'name': 'paul luse', 'email': 'paul.e.luse@intel.com', 'username': 'peluse'}, {'_account_id': 12193, 'name': 'Hisashi Osanai', 'email': 'osanai.hisashi@jp.fujitsu.com', 'username': 'ho'}, {'_account_id': 13052, 'name': 'SwiftStack Cluster CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'swiftstack-cluster-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 15090, 'name': 'Elvis Teixeira', 'email': 'elvis.teixeira@lsbd.ufc.br', 'username': 'ElvisTeixeira'}, {'_account_id': 16233, 'name': 'Mauricio Lima', 'email': 'mauriciolimab@gmail.com', 'username': 'limamauricio'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-03-04 16:41:00.000000000', 'files': ['swift/obj/replicator.py', 'test/unit/obj/test_ssync_sender.py', 'swift/obj/ssync_sender.py', 'test/unit/obj/test_replicator.py'], 'message': "Cleanup object-replicator handoff/rebalance partition syncing

When removing a partition because of handoff or in response to a
rebalance, remove synced suffixes (and objects) based on the work
performed instead of with rmtree to minimize the impact of a long race
window while syncing the partition to the remote nodes (between the time
when jobs are collected, and the partition is removed).

Since a node which is no longer a primary location does not expect to
receive many updates to the part after a rebalance, this change mainly
effects handoff reversion.  When an object server is accepting writes as
a handoff it's replicator daemon is also trying to remove the partition
from the node after syncing it to the primaries.  If it receives a write
for a new suffix while syncing it will not remove the partition.  If it
is using ssync and receives a write for a different object (hash) while
syncing it will not remove the partition, but an update to a
successfully synced object may still be subject to a race
(clean_suffixes goes object by object, but still uses rmtree without
respect the synced timestamps).

After syncing and removing all suffixes in the partition, the
object-replicator will wait until the subsequent pass to remove the
hashes.pkl, the .lock file, and the otherwise empty partition dir with
rmtree.

Also cleanup the ssync interface for remote check jobs during efficient
cross region replication.

Closes bug #1408061

Change-Id: I40d107c567f02e219f04b1a74d7060f5280432d5
"}]
commit_message:
Cleanup object-replicator handoff/rebalance partition syncing

When removing a partition because of handoff or in response to a
rebalance, remove synced suffixes (and objects) based on the work
performed instead of with rmtree to minimize the impact of a long race
window while syncing the partition to the remote nodes (between the time
when jobs are collected, and the partition is removed).

Since a node which is no longer a primary location does not expect to
receive many updates to the part after a rebalance, this change mainly
effects handoff reversion.  When an object server is accepting writes as
a handoff it's replicator daemon is also trying to remove the partition
from the node after syncing it to the primaries.  If it receives a write
for a new suffix while syncing it will not remove the partition.  If it
is using ssync and receives a write for a different object (hash) while
syncing it will not remove the partition, but an update to a
successfully synced object may still be subject to a race
(clean_suffixes goes object by object, but still uses rmtree without
respect the synced timestamps).

After syncing and removing all suffixes in the partition, the
object-replicator will wait until the subsequent pass to remove the
hashes.pkl, the .lock file, and the otherwise empty partition dir with
rmtree.

Also cleanup the ssync interface for remote check jobs during efficient
cross region replication.

Closes bug #1408061

Change-Id: I40d107c567f02e219f04b1a74d7060f5280432d5

subject: Make probetest validation work for EC
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-23 22:50:26.000000000', 'files': ['test/probe/common.py'], 'message': "Make probetest validation work for EC

The __main__ in probe.common has historically supported a quick validation of
configured storage policies suitability for replication tests.  The new base
ProbeTest classes will select (or Skip) the test cases based on their ability
to find a suitable policy - but it won't tell you which policies are
configured that would be suitable - the __main__ in common can though.

Also make sure policy validation will use configuration of the replication
services to validate rsync endpoints.  This is a first step and making
probetests support seperate replication servers.

Change-Id: I2f1d5e0e805c052a396d6975bb43cc64994000d3
"}]
commit_message:
Make probetest validation work for EC

The __main__ in probe.common has historically supported a quick validation of
configured storage policies suitability for replication tests.  The new base
ProbeTest classes will select (or Skip) the test cases based on their ability
to find a suitable policy - but it won't tell you which policies are
configured that would be suitable - the __main__ in common can though.

Also make sure policy validation will use configuration of the replication
services to validate rsync endpoints.  This is a first step and making
probetests support seperate replication servers.

Change-Id: I2f1d5e0e805c052a396d6975bb43cc64994000d3

Change-Id: I39304f19d733f6ede1ccae69dd937449b5935e9e
'}]
commit_message:
Catch file open errors before calling ConfigParser

The ConfigParser.read() does not have a way to distinguish between
syntax issues and file access issues. Fortunately, there is a way
to preserve the low-level error message by using .readfp() instead.

Change-Id: I39304f19d733f6ede1ccae69dd937449b5935e9e

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-07-02 14:33:55.000000000', 'files': ['swift/common/wsgi.py'], 'message': 'FIX http header size constraint

eventlet.wsgi module contain 2 variable that controlling limit of HTTP
headers:
MAX_HEADER_LINE - limit the size on 1 header (one line).
MAX_TOTAL_HEADER_SIZE - limit the whole headers size.

Our code can configure only MAX_HEADER_LINE through
swift-constrains configuration section of swift.conf. This change set both
MAX_HEADER_LINE and MAX_TOTAL_HEADER_SIZE to our "max_header_size"
constraint.

Change-Id: I0fba3360892051720affe343d0b71aaa6edfed6e
'}]
commit_message:
FIX http header size constraint

eventlet.wsgi module contain 2 variable that controlling limit of HTTP
headers:
MAX_HEADER_LINE - limit the size on 1 header (one line).
MAX_TOTAL_HEADER_SIZE - limit the whole headers size.

Our code can configure only MAX_HEADER_LINE through
swift-constrains configuration section of swift.conf. This change set both
MAX_HEADER_LINE and MAX_TOTAL_HEADER_SIZE to our "max_header_size"
constraint.

Change-Id: I0fba3360892051720affe343d0b71aaa6edfed6e

subject: Better storage server eventlet logging
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 597, 'name': 'Pete Zaitcev', 'email': 'zaitcev@kotori.zaitcev.us', 'username': 'zaitcev'}, {'_account_id': 1179, 'name': 'Clay Gerrard', 'email': 'clay.gerrard@gmail.com', 'username': 'clay-gerrard'}, {'_account_id': 5600, 'name': 'Brian Cline', 'email': 'bcline@softlayer.com', 'username': 'briancline'}, {'_account_id': 7233, 'name': 'Matthew Oliver', 'email': 'matt@oliver.net.au', 'username': 'mattoliverau'}, {'_account_id': 13052, 'name': 'SwiftStack Cluster CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'swiftstack-cluster-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 15090, 'name': 'Elvis Teixeira', 'email': 'elvis.teixeira@lsbd.ufc.br', 'username': 'ElvisTeixeira'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-15 00:25:41.000000000', 'files': ['swift/common/base_storage_server.py', 'swift/obj/server.py', 'test/unit/account/test_server.py', 'test/unit/obj/test_server.py', 'swift/account/server.py', 'test/unit/container/test_server.py', 'swift/common/wsgi.py', 'doc/source/logs.rst', 'test/unit/common/test_wsgi.py', 'swift/container/server.py', 'swift/common/utils.py', 'test/unit/common/test_utils.py'], 'message': 'Better storage server eventlet logging

The eventlet hub can be finicky - she doesn't like it when someone else is in
the spotlight (i.e. blocks).  When she's in a mood like this, sometimes she
won't hand accepted connections to the application as quickly as they're
accepted and you see a request log line from a storage server indicating the
response was "handled quickly" well after the proxy hit a timeout and moved
onto another server.  When this happens it's because the eventlet hub is being
starved by blocking operations in the app, but there's little insight into how
much impact this blocking is effecting the server's response time.

Refactor more common request routing into the base_storage_server.  Add
contextual start time to the WSGI environment captured closer to when the
eventlet.wsgi.server's accept returns a new connection.  Log something closer
to the real transaction time in the storage server logs in addition to the
time the request was "in" our app.

More often that not the logged trans_time will be only nominally longer than
the request_time - but when the eventlet hub is starved because of other
blocking operations it can be notably different.

Change-Id: Id1ee9551196b175d542b0990dff03d00c3c3a6b8
'}]
commit_message:
Better storage server eventlet logging

The eventlet hub can be finicky - she doesn't like it when someone else is in
the spotlight (i.e. blocks).  When she's in a mood like this, sometimes she
won't hand accepted connections to the application as quickly as they're
accepted and you see a request log line from a storage server indicating the
response was "handled quickly" well after the proxy hit a timeout and moved
onto another server.  When this happens it's because the eventlet hub is being
starved by blocking operations in the app, but there's little insight into how
much impact this blocking is effecting the server's response time.

Refactor more common request routing into the base_storage_server.  Add
contextual start time to the WSGI environment captured closer to when the
eventlet.wsgi.server's accept returns a new connection.  Log something closer
to the real transaction time in the storage server logs in addition to the
time the request was "in" our app.

More often that not the logged trans_time will be only nominally longer than
the request_time - but when the eventlet hub is starved because of other
blocking operations it can be notably different.

Change-Id: Id1ee9551196b175d542b0990dff03d00c3c3a6b8

commit_message:
Initial implementation for the storlets spec

This new middleware for Openstack Swift allows to
dynamically add compute functions along the pipeline,
without needing to explicitly add new middleware.

This implementation handles both the PUT and GET
requests, including the GET SLO case.

The class StorletGatewayBase in
swift/common/middleware/storlet_common.py defines
the interface which separates the swift side from
the compute engine side.
This initial implementation uses a stub gateway
implementation.

A code reference with a real (docker) implementation
can be found at:
https://github.com/Open-I-Beam/swift-storlets

*NOT* included in this initial patch and left for
amendment(s):
1.  the Unit tests
2.  The spec reviewer's suggestions/requirements

The spec is at https://review.openstack.org/#/c/164537/

First amendment done for fixing pep8 problems
Amendment2: further pep8 fixes. learnt to use "tox -v -epep8" and not "pep8"...

Change-Id: Ic129e922aed14133316199a0e59de04a03de49e7

commit_message:
Adds capability to specify config file

This commit adds a widget that allows for file or direct input of
VDU config values during VNF creation. This will bring VNF creation
via horizon in parity with what is currently available in
python-tackerclient

Change-Id: I828a6f5787484a17b1590e144798e25d00a2bfd9
Closes-Bug: #1493558

subject: Prevent to decode with invalid ec scheme
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-06-02 05:44:06.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/proxy/test_server.py', 'test/unit/__init__.py', 'swift/proxy/controllers/obj.py'], 'message': "Prevent to decode with invalid ec scheme

Basically, we must not deploy overwrite the ec policy scheme
if we have already have some objects in the policy becuase
absolutely we won't be able to get the correct data from the
Swift with the overwritten policy.

However, in the such a case, current Swift would return the garbage
(i.e. decorded but incorrect object) and user might not find the fact
it is the garbase, unfortunately.

To prevent the situation, this patch adds a validation that
the swift could decode the FAs correctly.

TODO: Create validater for other similar stuffs (e.g. ec_segment_size)

Change-Id: I4e4955341f78c3eda68890a75d3a8f59322543ef
"}]
commit_message:
Prevent to decode with invalid ec scheme

Basically, we must not deploy overwrite the ec policy scheme
if we have already have some objects in the policy becuase
absolutely we won't be able to get the correct data from the
Swift with the overwritten policy.

However, in the such a case, current Swift would return the garbage
(i.e. decorded but incorrect object) and user might not find the fact
it is the garbase, unfortunately.

To prevent the situation, this patch adds a validation that
the swift could decode the FAs correctly.

TODO: Create validater for other similar stuffs (e.g. ec_segment_size)

Change-Id: I4e4955341f78c3eda68890a75d3a8f59322543ef

commit_message:
change deprecated assertEquals to assertEqual

fix against H234: assertEquals() logs a DeprecationWarning
in Python3.x. use assertEqual() instead.And the same, change assertNotEquals() to assertNotEqual().

Closes-bug: #1489031
Change-Id: I7f91f00e848d1630ec83d9d0b409c4fed6f12a3e

commit_message:
bin directory: :Replace python print operator with print function (pep H233, py33)

'print' function is compatible with 2.x and 3.x python versions
Link : https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3105/

Python 2.6 has a __future__ import that removes print as language syntax,
letting you use the functional form instead

Change-Id: I379b47c63fd80b617fe4d5972f1d6a0ebee941c4

subject: go: pass vars to container update
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-10-17 02:31:56.000000000', 'files': ['go/objectserver/main.go', 'go/objectserver/update_test.go', 'go/objectserver/update.go'], 'message': "go: pass vars to container update

Since we kick container updates out to a background goroutine and let the
request handler return, the vars context can be cleared before GetVars is
called.

That means means it doesn't know what device the request was for when saving
asyncs, and it just dumps it into the device root.

Change-Id: I8fff740fa470b9d5012864ed92c8d0767efcb519
"}]
commit_message:
go: pass vars to container update

Since we kick container updates out to a background goroutine and let the
request handler return, the vars context can be cleared before GetVars is
called.

That means means it doesn't know what device the request was for when saving
asyncs, and it just dumps it into the device root.

Change-Id: I8fff740fa470b9d5012864ed92c8d0767efcb519

commit_message:
Updated the neutron l3HA tool to use v3

The change adds Keystone v3 support to neutron l3 ha tool. This
change is needed to ensure that all l3-ha fail overs are
accomplished correctly.

The tool has been updated to skip / support routers that have
already bene setup using the built in neutron L3HA.

This is something that will need to be backported to Kilo

Change-Id: I94f21ff3fa511bc9da6b57cdf847719620818ece
Closes-Bug: #1499708
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit 2108d7fe03427eb9cb6c52a4edd4755582f05fe7)

commit_message:
Make a few IP methods private

We're getting close to a 1.0 release, and these methods have terrible
interfaces. They're also not used anywhere. So let's make them private
for now, and if we find a time in the future where we need to expose
them, we can do that.

Change-Id: I357dbc0c2e61a5b9f62bfbd45595992d7eb21909

subject: Additional RabbitMQ SSL fixes
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-10-20 07:04:07.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/rabbitmq_server/tasks/rabbitmq_ssl_key_create.yml', 'playbooks/roles/rabbitmq_server/tasks/rabbitmq_ssl_key_distribute.yml', 'playbooks/roles/rabbitmq_server/templates/rabbitmq.config.j2'], 'message': "Additional RabbitMQ SSL fixes

This patch fixes two problems with RabbitMQ's SSL/TLS listener.

* When self-signed certificates are used, the CA cert isn't created, but it's
  included with the RabbitMQ server config anyway (bug 1507364).

* Self-signed certificates are owned by root within RabbitMQ's configuration
  directory and are unreadable by RabbitMQ. User-provided certificates aren't
  affected (bug 1506992).

Closes-bug: 1506992
Closes-bug: 1507364

Change-Id: If4f6a325eea4772f2fad4604785241b67adfaaf6
(cherry picked from commit d7031f954de7d73a96c303aed8b6e1f4441c03b0)
"}]
commit_message:
Additional RabbitMQ SSL fixes

This patch fixes two problems with RabbitMQ's SSL/TLS listener.

* When self-signed certificates are used, the CA cert isn't created, but it's
  included with the RabbitMQ server config anyway (bug 1507364).

* Self-signed certificates are owned by root within RabbitMQ's configuration
  directory and are unreadable by RabbitMQ. User-provided certificates aren't
  affected (bug 1506992).

Closes-bug: 1506992
Closes-bug: 1507364

Change-Id: If4f6a325eea4772f2fad4604785241b67adfaaf6
(cherry picked from commit d7031f954de7d73a96c303aed8b6e1f4441c03b0)

subject: Make designate record methods private for now
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-10-20 16:55:42.000000000', 'files': ['shade/tests/unit/test_shade.py', 'shade/__init__.py'], 'message': 'Make designate record methods private for now

The API for designate is not something we can commit to right now. It
turns out that v1 has Domains and Records and v2 has Zones, RecordSets
and Records. Figuring out an API design that can handle both is not
going to happen before 1.0, so mark the current Record API as private
so that we can add something we can commit to later.

Change-Id: Ia2611f19d04a2d7a51d85ac99f19ed4054972085
'}]
commit_message:
Make designate record methods private for now

The API for designate is not something we can commit to right now. It
turns out that v1 has Domains and Records and v2 has Zones, RecordSets
and Records. Figuring out an API design that can handle both is not
going to happen before 1.0, so mark the current Record API as private
so that we can add something we can commit to later.

Change-Id: Ia2611f19d04a2d7a51d85ac99f19ed4054972085

Testing Alarming is really important when testing Ceilometer, Aodh and
Gnocchi.

Without alarming tests, there is no way to test Aodh in 'smoke' suite.
This patch adds the decorator so Alarming tests are part of 'smoke'
tests.

Change-Id: I74b4f76d94b838e2fa5dbbbaed80d28341327f64

commit_message:
telemetry: add alarming tests in 'smoke' suite

Testing Alarming is really important when testing Ceilometer, Aodh and
Gnocchi.

Without alarming tests, there is no way to test Aodh in 'smoke' suite.
This patch adds the decorator so Alarming tests are part of 'smoke'
tests.

Change-Id: I74b4f76d94b838e2fa5dbbbaed80d28341327f64

I68200a23c87ceca5a237da13d9549c0aa82f1b8f has changed two scripts

environment for those scripts, which will cause error when trying

commit_message:
specify runtime environment for scripts

I68200a23c87ceca5a237da13d9549c0aa82f1b8f has changed two scripts
to be executable, but unfortunately, it forgets to specify runtime
environment for those scripts, which will cause error when trying
to run those scripts directly.

This patch adds python environment specification for them.

Change-Id: Ibbcefb671de76146529b9a6e2debfee154a1aaa7

Previously, the PowerVM power_on Job was broken for bootmode='sms', so
the rescue flow skipped this step, leaving it to the user to boot to SMS
manually.  The power_on Job now works, so this change set restores the
boot step to the rescue flow.

Change-Id: I71e28dcbb96ae580ac3ebb54582eee9a039b9ae6
(cherry picked from commit 2deaae0fe59abffbca6f7b156bcc805ea4e0e11f)
"}]
commit_message:
Rescue boots to SMS

Previously, the PowerVM power_on Job was broken for bootmode='sms', so
the rescue flow skipped this step, leaving it to the user to boot to SMS
manually.  The power_on Job now works, so this change set restores the
boot step to the rescue flow.

Change-Id: I71e28dcbb96ae580ac3ebb54582eee9a039b9ae6
(cherry picked from commit 2deaae0fe59abffbca6f7b156bcc805ea4e0e11f)

subject: Switch to post-versioning
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-10-19 03:18:21.000000000', 'files': ['setup.cfg'], 'message': 'Switch to post-versioning

No longer mention next version on setup.cfg on stable branch.

oslo.utils 2.6.0 causing tox test to hang.
This forces a specific version of oslo.utils *before* the
requirements are loaded, thus ensuring that 2.6.0 is *not* used.
(This is a temporary fix until oslo.util pushes a new version.)

Depends-On: Ica981756c67902e7fd7bd07ff76c5b679e8e4e2f
Change-Id: I97ec9d17b6a611d888ef007575a29c1811f475c9
'}]
commit_message:
Switch to post-versioning

No longer mention next version on setup.cfg on stable branch.

oslo.utils 2.6.0 causing tox test to hang.
This forces a specific version of oslo.utils *before* the
requirements are loaded, thus ensuring that 2.6.0 is *not* used.
(This is a temporary fix until oslo.util pushes a new version.)

Depends-On: Ica981756c67902e7fd7bd07ff76c5b679e8e4e2f
Change-Id: I97ec9d17b6a611d888ef007575a29c1811f475c9

When performing delete_initiator, this should not

gotten out of sync, but the teardown should be

Closes-Bug: #1506496
Change-Id: I3fa9d2e4a435de7c8ee5b24d419930050af197fe

commit_message:
LIO: Let delete_initiator succeed if iqn not found

When performing delete_initiator, this should not
raise an error if it can't find the initiator in
an ACL.  This likely indicates something has
gotten out of sync, but the teardown should be
allowed to succeed.

Closes-Bug: #1506496
Change-Id: I3fa9d2e4a435de7c8ee5b24d419930050af197fe

subject: Initial wwpn only valid if no existing WWPNs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-10-20 18:15:55.000000000', 'files': ['nova_powervm/tests/virt/powervm/volume/test_npiv.py', 'nova_powervm/virt/powervm/volume/npiv.py'], 'message': "Initial wwpn only valid if no existing WWPNs

The 'is_initial_wwpn' was simply looking at the fabric state and task
state.  However, if multiple BDMs were specified on a deploy, this would
cause multiple WWPNs to be generated for the same fabric (because each
would be considered 'initial').

This change set expands the logic to also check if any WWPNs have been
set on the fabric yet.  If so, it is not considered an initial WWPN.

Change-Id: I03767f406e004349015483ef8b696f72c57d8ede
Closes-Bug: 1507774
(cherry picked from commit a5995ffc2d5c4ee91bd045ebb2f0ea6ed0deca8d)
"}]
commit_message:
Initial wwpn only valid if no existing WWPNs

The 'is_initial_wwpn' was simply looking at the fabric state and task
state.  However, if multiple BDMs were specified on a deploy, this would
cause multiple WWPNs to be generated for the same fabric (because each
would be considered 'initial').

This change set expands the logic to also check if any WWPNs have been
set on the fabric yet.  If so, it is not considered an initial WWPN.

Change-Id: I03767f406e004349015483ef8b696f72c57d8ede
Closes-Bug: 1507774
(cherry picked from commit a5995ffc2d5c4ee91bd045ebb2f0ea6ed0deca8d)

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-09-18 14:16:27.000000000', 'files': ['elements/hadoop/install.d/40-setup-hadoop', 'elements/hadoop/install.d/firstboot', 'elements/hadoop/package-installs.yaml'], 'message': 'hadoop: move scripts from post-install.d to install.d

As also the previous comment on the top of 40-setup-hadoop said, this
was done because the Hadoop v1 RPM was buggy, so it needed to be
installed after the rest of the system is set up.

Since the support for Hadoop v1 has been dropped, the installation of
Hadoop can be done in install.d.

Change-Id: If3b0f8f595d6bf36017e63d331b5c1f7faa532e2
'}]
commit_message:
hadoop: move scripts from post-install.d to install.d

As also the previous comment on the top of 40-setup-hadoop said, this
was done because the Hadoop v1 RPM was buggy, so it needed to be
installed after the rest of the system is set up.

Since the support for Hadoop v1 has been dropped, the installation of
Hadoop can be done in install.d.

Change-Id: If3b0f8f595d6bf36017e63d331b5c1f7faa532e2

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-10-20 09:24:30.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/mapping_combinations.rst'], 'message': "Fix incorrect federated mapping example

The documentation didn't provide correct example of a mapping rules with
direct group mapping (with blacklist/whitelist keyword).
This could led users to a major confusion.

The example is now fixed. Additionaly, for clarity and increased
readibility the ``user`` and ``groups``
objects were split into separate ``local`` rules.

Change-Id: Iff343f1ff2829ef282a1314fd07203a435611e70
Closes-Bug: #1507944
"}]
commit_message:
Fix incorrect federated mapping example

The documentation didn't provide correct example of a mapping rules with
direct group mapping (with blacklist/whitelist keyword).
This could led users to a major confusion.

The example is now fixed. Additionaly, for clarity and increased
readibility the ``user`` and ``groups``
objects were split into separate ``local`` rules.

Change-Id: Iff343f1ff2829ef282a1314fd07203a435611e70
Closes-Bug: #1507944

commit_message:
Huawei driver handle volume exists error

Currently when we create a volume on an array
where that volume already exists,
there will be an exception. But in fact it should
just go on and doesn't need an exception.

Closes-Bug: #1504718
Change-Id: I13a52e81c1c271ea6728cb4a23717609d95bae69

subject: Search for existing aodh binary
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-10-20 13:50:49.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/os_aodh/tasks/aodh_post_install.yml'], 'message': 'Search for existing aodh binary

The os_aodh role fails to run when aodh_venv_enabled is set to false.
This is because the role searches for an aodh binary which does not
exist.  This commit updates os_aodh to search for aodh-api instead,
which is a valid binary installed by aodh.

Change-Id: Ic64d1cb8a301c0716e6cd05554b7806847769472
Closes-Bug: #1508052
'}]
commit_message:
Search for existing aodh binary

The os_aodh role fails to run when aodh_venv_enabled is set to false.
This is because the role searches for an aodh binary which does not
exist.  This commit updates os_aodh to search for aodh-api instead,
which is a valid binary installed by aodh.

Change-Id: Ic64d1cb8a301c0716e6cd05554b7806847769472
Closes-Bug: #1508052

subject: Fixes TLS processing in the rest driver
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2015-10-20 05:53:25.000000000', 'files': ['octavia/common/tls_utils/cert_parser.py', 'octavia/amphorae/drivers/haproxy/rest_api_driver.py', 'octavia/tests/unit/amphorae/drivers/haproxy/test_rest_api_driver.py'], 'message': 'Fixes TLS processing in the rest driver

The rest driver was not using updated cert utils to
handle processing of TLS certificates and would cause failures.

Also updates build_pem to be py34 compliant.

Change-Id: I05db39ff673083649735434f8e4cc710086ffd54
Closes-Bug: #1507723
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes TLS processing in the rest driver

The rest driver was not using updated cert utils to
handle processing of TLS certificates and would cause failures.

Also updates build_pem to be py34 compliant.

Change-Id: I05db39ff673083649735434f8e4cc710086ffd54
Closes-Bug: #1507723

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-10-20 18:08:09.000000000', 'files': ['gerrit/projects.yaml', 'gerrit/acls/stackforge/networking-bigswitch.config'], 'message': 'Unretire the stackforge/networking-bigswitch repo

The maintainers for stackforge/networking-bigswitch misunderstood
the stackforge namespace retirement and move announcements and did
not realize their repository would be retired in the recent
maintenance. Restore it for now until it can be batched into a
future rename maintenance.

Change-Id: Id66cd51c5c526d8e1869bbaaedc5c0f9be886daf

commit_message:
Unretire the stackforge/networking-bigswitch repo

The maintainers for stackforge/networking-bigswitch misunderstood
the stackforge namespace retirement and move announcements and did
not realize their repository would be retired in the recent
maintenance. Restore it for now until it can be batched into a
future rename maintenance.

Change-Id: Id66cd51c5c526d8e1869bbaaedc5c0f9be886daf

in current perestroika code
